cocktails.name: 20th Century
cocktails.instructions: Shake with ice and strain into a chilled coupe. Garnish with a lemon twist.
cocktails.story: The British bartender C.A. Tuck named this cocktail after the 20th Century Limited, a luxury train that ran between New York City and Chicago from 1902 until 1967.

ingredients.name: Marie Brizard White Creme de Cacao

cocktails.name: Benton's Old Fashioned
cocktails.instructions: Stir with ice and strain into a chilled rocks glass filled with one large ice cube. Garnish with an orange twist.
cocktails.story: In 2007, Don Lee 'fat-washed' four bottles of Four Roses Bourbon with two ounces of Allan Benton's smoky Tennessee bacon fat for our winter menu.

cocktails.name: Blood and Sand
cocktails.instructions: Shake with ice and strain into a chilled coupe. No garnish.
cocktails.story: Named after the 1922 Rudolph Valentino movie of the same name, this recipe originally called for equal parts of each ingredient.

cocktails.name: El Puente
cocktails.instructions: Shake with ice and strain into a chilled, Del Maguey Vida Mezcal-rinsed coupe. Garnish with a grapefruit twist.
cocktails.story: This cocktail was created to 'bridge' the figurative gap between tequila and mezcal by featuring the two side by side in a cocktail.

cocktails.name: Falling Leaves
cocktails.instructions: Stir with ice and strain into a chilled coupe. Garnish with a star anise pod.
cocktails.story: Audrey Saunders created this autumnal, wine-based cocktail at Bemelman's Bar, in the Carlyle Hotel, in 2004.

cocktails.name: Bobby Burns
cocktails.instructions: Stir with ice and strain into a chilled coupe. Garnish with a lemon twist.
cocktails.story: Robert Burns is widely regarded as Scotland's national bard. Like many of the world's greatest authors, he has a cocktail named after him.

cocktails.name: Cameron's Kick
cocktails.instructions: Shake with ice and strain into a chilled coupe. No garnish.
cocktails.story: There should be a law against creating great drinks with provocative titles and not including a story. This one is still shrouded in mystery.

cocktails.name: Caprice
cocktails.instructions: Stir with ice and strain into a chilled coupe. Garnish with an orange twist.
cocktails.story: Abe Marco and Hyman Gale imported fine wine and spirits in Chicago. Their manual includes an extensive wine and spirits overview and a fine collection of classic and unusual concoctions.

cocktails.name: Coconut Colada
cocktails.instructions: Shake with ice and strain into a chilled coupe. Garnish with a lime wheel.
cocktails.story: In 2006, a guest asked me to make her a Piña Colada at Gramercy Tavern. We didn't stock Coco López, so I used a scoop of coconut sorbet in place of the rich cream.

ingredients.name: Flor de Caña Silver Dry Rum

cocktails.name: Coda
cocktails.instructions: Dry-shake, then shake with ice and strain into a chilled fizz glass. Garnish with grated nutmeg.
cocktails.story: In music, a coda (Italian for tail) is a passage that brings conclusion to a particular piece.

cocktails.name: Allies Cocktail
cocktails.instructions: Stir with ice and strain into a chilled coupe. Garnish with an orange twist.
cocktails.story: Named for the Allies of World War I, this cocktail features gin and vermouth, and is named for the Chunnel that connects England and France.

cocktails.name: Americano Highball
cocktails.instructions: Build in a chilled Collins glass. Add ice and top with 2.5 oz. Club Soda. Garnish with half an orange wheel.
cocktails.story: Originally called the Milano-Torino, this drink was so popular among American tourists, the Italian barmen renamed it in their honor.

cocktails.name: Algonquin
cocktails.instructions: Stir with ice and strain into a chilled coupe. No garnish.
cocktails.story: This drink was named after the historic Manhattan hotel where a number of famous writers, artists, and actors (members of the Algonquin Round Table) gathered for lunch before Prohibition went into effect.

cocktails.name: Pimms Cup
cocktails.instructions: Muddle the cucumber and simple syrup. Add Pimms and lemon juice, then shake with ice and strain into a chilled Collins glass filled with ice. Top with 1 oz. Fever-Tree Ginger Ale. Garnish with a cucumber wheel.
cocktails.story: James Pimm became famous for his house cup, a gin sling with a proprietary mix of liqueurs and fruit extracts in the 19th century.

cocktails.name: Gold Rush
cocktails.instructions: Shake with ice and strain into a chilled rocks glass filled with ice. No garnish.
cocktails.story: T. J. Siegal created this modern classic at Milk & Honey. It is essentially a Whiskey Sour with honey syrup instead of simple syrup.

cocktails.name: Harvest Moon
cocktails.instructions: Stir with ice and strain over one large cube into a chilled rocks glass. Garnish with grated nutmeg.
cocktails.story: This cocktail was inspired by the seasonal transition from summer to fall, using local ingredients like Chardonnay from Long Island.

cocktails.name: Pearl of Puebla
cocktails.instructions: Muddle the oregano and agave nectar. Add everything else, then shake with ice and fine-strain into a chilled coupe. No garnish.
cocktails.story: Fashioned as a Mexican rendition of Audrey Saunders's French Pearl, this uses two staples of Puebla cuisine: mezcal and fresh oregano.

cocktails.name: Perfect Pear
cocktails.instructions: Shake with ice and strain into a chilled, half sugar-rimmed coupe. No garnish.
cocktails.story: Marco created this drink for his ex-wife, Sarah, naming it in honor of their marriage and the King Crimson song Three of a Perfect Pair.

cocktails.name: Blinker
cocktails.instructions: Shake with ice and strain into a chilled coupe. No garnish.
cocktails.story: Ted Haigh's Vintage Spirits and Forgotten Cocktails jump-started the classic cocktail renaissance in 2004 by featuring lost drinks such as the Blinker.

cocktails.name: Cafe Arroz
cocktails.instructions: Shake with ice and strain into a chilled coupe. Garnish with grated cinnamon.
cocktails.story: Tequila and horchata, two staples of Mexican cuisine, just happen to work really well in place of vodka and cream in the White Russian cocktail.

cocktails.name: Duboudreau Cocktail
cocktails.instructions: Stir with ice and strain into a chilled coupe. Garnish with a lemon twist.
cocktails.story: Seattle-based mixologist Jamie Boudreau created a Fernet and elderflower-accented rye cocktail called the Cooper Cocktail. I added Dubonnet and named it after him.

cocktails.name: Foreign Legion
cocktails.instructions: Stir with ice and strain over an ice sphere into a chilled rocks glass. Garnish with an orange twist.
cocktails.story: Jonathon Sabathe helped Greg perfect the proportions of this rich rum drink he served during a guest-bartending stint at PDT.

ingredients.name: Marie Brizard Dark Creme de Cacao

cocktails.name: Negroni
cocktails.instructions: Stir with ice and strain into a chilled coupe or over ice in a chilled rocks glass. Garnish with an orange twist.
cocktails.story: The combination of gin, sweet vermouth, and Campari showed up as the Camparinette and the Campari Cardinal in French and Spanish cocktail books before being recognized universally as the Negroni.

cocktails.name: Death Bed
cocktails.instructions: Build in a chilled Collins glass. Fill with pebble ice and swizzle. Add more ice and garnish with a lime wheel and brandied cherries on a pick.
cocktails.story: John Deragon created this cocktail to assuage the aches and pains of a cold that had left him bedridden.

cocktails.name: New Amsterdam
cocktails.instructions: Stir with ice and strain into a chilled coupe. Garnish with a lemon twist.
cocktails.story: Manhattan was first colonized by Dutch traders, who renamed the island and surrounding area New Amsterdam.

cocktails.name: Figetaboutit
cocktails.instructions: Shake with ice and fine-strain into a chilled coupe. Garnish with an orange twist wrapped around three brandied cherries on a pick.
cocktails.story: When Lindsay Nader and I were debating potential names for her bittersweet Italian-American whiskey sour, barman Sean Hoard smiled and said figetaboutit.

cocktails.name: Flying Dutchman
cocktails.instructions: Shake with ice and strain into a chilled coupe. Garnish with one brandied cherry.
cocktails.story: An ancestor of the Aviation Cocktail, the name references Dutch genever, not the cursed ship forever lost at sea.

cocktails.name: Fog Cutter
cocktails.instructions: Shake with ice and pour unstrained into a chilled tiki mug. Float 0.5 oz of Lustau Cream Sherry on top. Garnish with a mint sprig.
cocktails.story: Tiki historian Jeff Berry called this drink the Long Island Iced Tea of exotic drinks.

cocktails.name: Platanos en Mole Old Fashioned
cocktails.instructions: Stir with ice and strain over one large cube into a chilled rocks glass. Garnish with a pinch of ground chili.
cocktails.story: Inspired by the classic dessert, this cocktail was first served at the Star Chefs International Chefs Conference in New York City.

cocktails.name: Prince of Wales
cocktails.instructions: Stir with ice and strain into a chilled coupe. No garnish.
cocktails.story: Albert Edward, Prince of Wales and son of Queen Victoria, was the first member of the British royal family to visit North America in 1860.

cocktails.name: Rye Witch
cocktails.instructions: Add the bitters and sugar cube to a mixing glass and muddle to a paste. Add everything else, then stir with ice and strain into a chilled rocks glass. Twist an orange peel over the surface and discard.
cocktails.story: I tend to include witch, strega in Italian, in a drink's title whenever we mix with it.

cocktails.name: Sage Old Buck
cocktails.instructions: Muddle the black peppercorns with the simple syrup. Add everything else, then shake with ice and fine-strain into a chilled Collins glass filled with ice. Garnish with a smacked sage leaf.
cocktails.story: We sorted all the produce and chose vanilla, black pepper, and sage to pair with the malt.

cocktails.name: Framboise Fizz
cocktails.instructions: Shake with ice and strain into a chilled egg coupe. Top with 2 oz of Lindemans Framboise Lambic. No garnish.
cocktails.story: Michael Klein chose Framboise, a Belgian ale produced by combining fresh raspberries and young lambic, to complement two old friends: tequila and chocolate.

ingredients.name: Marie Brizard White Creme de Cacao

cocktails.name: Daiquiri
cocktails.instructions: Shake with ice and strain into a chilled coupe. Garnish with a lime wheel.
cocktails.story: Charles H. Baker claims his friends Harry Stout and Jennings Cox created the Daiquiri in a village of the same name situated outside the Bacardi plant in Santiago de Cuba.

cocktails.name: Ephemeral
cocktails.instructions: Stir with ice and strain into a chilled coupe. Garnish with a grapefruit twist.
cocktails.story: David Shenaut created this cocktail for friend and bar regular Matthew Schuler, who brought him his first bottle of celery bitters.

cocktails.name: Espresso Bongo
cocktails.instructions: Shake with ice and pour unstrained into a chilled tiki mug. No garnish.
cocktails.story: Tiki cocktail guru and author Jeff "Beachbum" Berry created this cocktail, named after the 1959 British beatnik movie Expresso Bongo.

cocktails.name: Field Cocktail
cocktails.instructions: Stir with ice and strain into a chilled coupe. Garnish with a pineapple leaf.
cocktails.story: This cognac-driven variation on the rye-based Algonquin Cocktail is a tribute to Colin Peter Field, who runs the Hemingway Bar in Paris's Ritz Hotel.

cocktails.name: Fish House Punch
cocktails.instructions: Shake with ice and strain into a chilled rocks glass filled with ice. Garnish with grated nutmeg.
cocktails.story: The original recipe was mixed with a peach eau de vie aged in wood barrels that has not been produced commercially in over a century.

cocktails.name: Flora Astoria
cocktails.instructions: Stir with ice and strain into a chilled coupe. Garnish with a sprig of dried lavender.
cocktails.story: Lindsay Nader and Anne Robinson collaborated on this flowery spin on the classic Astoria cocktail, named after the annex added to the Old Waldorf hotel in 1897.

cocktails.name: Honeymoon Cocktail
cocktails.instructions: Shake with ice and strain into a chilled coupe. No garnish.
cocktails.story: This cocktail has a spirituous backbone that is sure to cast a fog over the most amorous honeymoon.

cocktails.name: Lake George
cocktails.instructions: Shake with ice and strain into a chilled coupe. No garnish.
cocktails.story: Brian Shebairo came up with this cocktail while vacationing along the sunny shores of Lake George.

ingredients.name: Glenlivet 12 Year Old Single Malt Scotch Whisky

cocktails.name: La Louche
cocktails.instructions: Shake with ice and strain into a chilled coupe. No garnish.
cocktails.story: Louche means questionable or mischievous behavior. Consider this cocktail as its inspiration.

cocktails.name: Nth Degree
cocktails.instructions: Muddle the sugar cube and bitters. Add everything else, then stir with ice and strain over one large cube into a chilled rocks glass. Garnish with an orange and lemon twist.
cocktails.story: Nate was intrigued by spirituous, old-fashioned-style cocktails at Milk & Honey that split a cocktail's base between two complementary spirits.

ingredients.name: Fee Brothers Whiskey Barrel Aged Bitters

cocktails.name: Pearl Button
cocktails.instructions: Shake with ice and strain into a chilled Collins glass filled with ice. Top with 1.5 oz. of San Pellegrino Limonata. Garnish with half a grapefruit wheel.
cocktails.story: The combination of ingredients gave off an opalescent glimmer, reminding John of the pearl buttons on the vest he wore behind the bar.

cocktails.name: Primavera
cocktails.instructions: Muddle the Cointreau and vegetables. Add everything else, then shake with ice and fine-strain into a chilled St. George Absinthe-rinsed coupe. Garnish with an orange twist.
cocktails.story: Before the flowers blossom and the berries ripen, root vegetables such as fennel and celery are all you can get at the market until flowering shoots such as asparagus appear.

cocktails.name: Royal Bermuda Yacht Club Cocktail
cocktails.instructions: Shake with ice and strain into a chilled coupe. Garnish with a lime wheel.
cocktails.story: After reading about this drink in Vintage Spirits and Forgotten Cocktails in 2004, I picked up a bottle of Velvet Falernum and have stocked it in all the bars I've run ever since.

cocktails.name: Rusty Nail
cocktails.instructions: Stir with ice and strain over one large cube into a chilled rocks glass. Garnish with a lemon twist.
cocktails.story: According to David Wondrich, the B.I.F. cocktail, composed of Scotch and Drambuie, first appeared in 1937. Now known as the Rusty Nail, the recipe under this name didn't appear in popular cocktail books until the 1970s.

cocktails.name: Sazerac
cocktails.instructions: Stir with ice and strain into a chilled, Pernod Absinthe-rinsed rocks glass (no ice). Garnish with a lemon twist.
cocktails.story: The Sazerac is the official cocktail of New Orleans.

cocktails.name: Shiso Malt Sour
cocktails.instructions: Shake with ice and strain over one large cube into a chilled rocks glass. Garnish with a shiso leaf.
cocktails.story: This cocktail was inspired by the refreshing Japanese highball and the herbaceous shiso leaf common in Japanese cuisine.

cocktails.name: Seelbach Cocktail
cocktails.instructions: Stir with ice and strain into a chilled coupe. Top with 2 oz. Moet Imperial Champagne. Garnish with an orange twist.
cocktails.story: Chicagoan Adam Seger discovered this pre-Prohibition recipe during his tenure at Louisville's historic Seelbach Hotel in 1995.

cocktails.name: Professor
cocktails.instructions: Stir with ice and strain into a chilled coupe. No garnish.
cocktails.story: The Professor is Michael Klein's rum-based variation on the Chancellor cocktail from Frederick Birmingham's Esquire Drink Book.

cocktails.name: Remember the Maine
cocktails.instructions: Stir with ice and strain into a chilled, absinthe-rinsed coupe. Garnish with one brandied cherry.
cocktails.story: Baker describes this as a hazy memory from Havana during the 1933 revolution, noting it should be handled with care.

cocktails.name: Tom Collins
cocktails.instructions: Shake with ice and strain into a chilled Collins glass filled with ice. Top with 2 oz. club soda. Garnish with a lemon wheel and a brandied cherry.
cocktails.story: This cocktail was named after John Collins, a waiter at Limmer's Hotel in London, who was famous for his gin punch.

cocktails.name: Seelbach Cocktail (Bitters-Forward)
cocktails.instructions: Stir with ice and strain into a chilled coupe. Top with 2 oz. Moet Imperial Champagne. Garnish with an orange twist.
cocktails.story: A bitters-forward variation of Adam Seger's Seelbach Cocktail using increased aromatic and Peychauds bitters.

cocktails.name: Silver Lining
cocktails.instructions: Shake with ice and strain into a chilled coupe. Garnish with grated nutmeg.
cocktails.story: A light, refreshing whiskey sour variation intended to show the softer side of rye.

cocktails.name: Vieux Carré
cocktails.instructions: Stir with ice and strain over one large cube into a chilled rocks glass. Garnish with a lemon twist.
cocktails.story: Named after the French Quarter in New Orleans, this recipe was first served at the Hotel Monteleone in the late 1930s.

cocktails.name: Blackstar
cocktails.instructions: Shake with ice and strain into a chilled coupe. Garnish with a star anise pod.
cocktails.story: The Blackstar was created with Smirnoff Black, a full-bodied vodka that isn't available in the U.S., and named after the whole star anise pod that floats on the surface as an aromatic garnish.

cocktails.name: Black Thorn (English)
cocktails.instructions: Stir with ice and strain into a chilled coupe. Garnish with an orange twist.
cocktails.story: The sloe berries used to produce Plymouth Sloe Gin are harvested from blackthorn bushes that grow uncultivated throughout England.

cocktails.name: Black Thorn (Irish)
cocktails.instructions: Stir with ice and strain into a chilled, St. George Absinthe-rinsed coupe. Garnish with a lemon twist.
cocktails.story: Although this drink wasn't named after the Irish whiskey (which was launched in 1934), the higher proportion of malt whiskey in Black Bush gives it the body to stand up to the absinthe and bitters.

cocktails.name: Black Thorn Rose
cocktails.instructions: Stir with ice and strain into a chilled coupe. No garnish.
cocktails.story: To enhance the primary botanical in Hendricks Gin, David came up with this rose-accented variation on the classic that employs Lillet Rouge, Dubonnet's Bordelaise brethren.

cocktails.name: Ti' Punch
cocktails.instructions: Squeeze the lime disc into a chilled rocks glass. Add everything else and top with pebble ice. Swizzle twice. No garnish.
cocktails.story: Ed Hamilton, who exports rhum from Martinique, is largely responsible for importing this Caribbean classic to the United States.

cocktails.name: Tipperary Cocktail
cocktails.instructions: Stir with ice and strain into a chilled coupe. Garnish with a lemon twist.
cocktails.story: Named after the county in Ireland, this classic appears in Ensslin's 1916 guide.

cocktails.name: Pharaoh Cooler
cocktails.instructions: Shake with ice and strain into a chilled Collins glass filled with ice. Top with 1 oz. club soda. No garnish.
cocktails.story: Named after the mythic Egyptian origin of watermelon seeds, this drink was so good we put it on the menu after Jack McGarry mixed it at PDT.

cocktails.name: Persephone
cocktails.instructions: Stir with ice and strain into a chilled coupe. No garnish.
cocktails.story: According to Greek mythology, the seasons were a result of Persephone's abduction by Hades; nature suffered while her mother, Demeter, searched for her.

cocktails.name: Paddington
cocktails.instructions: Shake with ice and strain into a chilled, absinthe-rinsed coupe. Garnish with a grapefruit twist.
cocktails.story: Named after the marmalade-loving bear from Michael Bond's stories, this is a rum-based variation on the Fitzgerald cocktail.

cocktails.name: Pumpkin Toddy
cocktails.instructions: Add everything to a pre-heated heatproof mug and stir. Top with 5 oz. hot water and stir. Garnish with grated cinnamon.
cocktails.story: An evolved 21st-century toddy using apple brandy, rye, pumpkin, and spice.

cocktails.name: Sazerac Boothby
cocktails.instructions: Muddle the sugar and bitters, add whiskey and ice, stir, and strain into an absinthe-rinsed rocks glass. Express lemon peel and discard.
cocktails.story: This version reflects the later rye-based Sazerac associated with the Sazerac Coffee House in New Orleans.

cocktails.name: Up To Date
cocktails.instructions: Stir with ice and strain into a chilled coupe. Garnish with a lemon twist.
cocktails.story: Another classic from Hugo Ensslin's 1916 collection.

cocktails.name: Vauvert Slim
cocktails.instructions: Muddle 6 mint leaves with lime juice. Add everything else and dry-shake. Shake with ice and fine-strain into a chilled, Laphroaig 10-Year-Old Single Malt Scotch-rinsed egg coupe. Garnish with a mint leaf.
cocktails.story: Vauvert was home to a Carthusian monastery where Francois Hannibal d'Estrees presented the monks with a manuscript for 'elixir of long life' in 1605.

cocktails.name: Prince Edward
cocktails.instructions: Stir with ice and strain into a chilled coupe. Garnish with an orange twist.
cocktails.story: Stan Jones's recipe didn't include bitters, but I felt a couple dashes of orange bitters improved the drink.

ingredients.name: Compass Box Oak Cross Blended Malt Scotch Whisky

cocktails.name: Rosita
cocktails.instructions: Stir with ice and strain into a chilled coupe. Garnish with an orange twist.
cocktails.story: Gary Regan popularised this drink, sans the dash of bitters, which he added along with a tad more tequila.

cocktails.name: Vaccari
cocktails.instructions: Stir with ice and strain over a large cube into a chilled rocks glass. Garnish with a grapefruit twist.
cocktails.story: This cocktail, named after the creator of Galliano, should be recommended to someone craving a spirituous drink on a hot summer day.

ingredients.name: Chamomile-Infused Compass Box Asyla Blended Scotch Whisky
